importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Date of the ceasefire agreement signed between Israel and Hamas, which mandated the return of all deceased hostages within 72 hours.
Date of the latest update on the return of a deceased hostage's body, indicating ongoing challenges in fulfilling the ceasefire terms.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The initial 72-hour window under the ceasefire agreement for returning deceased hostages, which has now passed and is being tested.
Current timeline of the identification and return of the remaining deceased hostages, highlighting delays and complications.

keyTakeAways: The Israeli military confirmed the receipt of a coffin carrying a deceased hostage's body from Gaza, which was transported into Israel for forensic identification.
Under the ceasefire agreement signed on October 9, Hamas was required to return all deceased hostages within 72 hours, but only 12 out of 28 bodies have been returned as of October 20, 2025.
One of the bodies previously returned by Hamas was not identified as an Israeli hostage, suggesting possible misidentification rather than intentional error.
The US-brokered ceasefire has faced challenges, with both Hamas and Israel accusing each other of violations, including failure to return deceased hostages.
A diplomatic push led by US officials Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner continues, with high-level meetings between Israeli military leaders and US envoys to resolve ceasefire disputes.
Knesset Speaker Amir Ohana emphasized that the return of all deceased hostages must be fulfilled 'one way or another,' underscoring political urgency.

namedEntities.name: Israel Defense Forces (IDF)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The IDF is central to the article as it confirms the receipt and handling of a deceased hostage's body and enforces the ceasefire obligations related to hostage return.

namedEntities.name: Hamas
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hamas is directly involved in the ceasefire agreement and is responsible for returning deceased hostages, which has become a point of contention and delay.

namedEntities.name: Red Cross
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Red Cross received a coffin with a deceased hostage’s remains, indicating a role in humanitarian coordination during the conflict.

namedEntities.name: Trump administration
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: U.S. government leadership during the period
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Trump administration brokered the ceasefire agreement, making it central to the diplomatic and political context of the conflict.

namedEntities.name: Steve Witkoff
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Special envoy of the Trump administration
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He played a key role in mediating the ceasefire and held direct talks with Israeli military leaders to address hostage return issues.

namedEntities.name: Jared Kushner
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Son-in-law of U.S. President Donald Trump
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He participated in high-level diplomatic meetings with Israeli military officials to resolve ceasefire disputes and ensure compliance with hostage return terms.

namedEntities.name: Amir Ohana
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He emphasized that the return of all deceased hostages is non-negotiable, reinforcing political pressure on Hamas to fulfill the agreement.

namedEntities.name: Sonthaya Oakkharasri
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Identified as one of the recently confirmed deceased hostages, highlighting international dimensions of the hostage crisis.

namedEntities.name: National Institute for Forensic Medicine
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The site where the deceased hostage’s body will be identified, central to the process of verifying the identity of the remains.

namedEntities.name: Donald Trump
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The ceasefire agreement was brokered under his administration, making his role foundational to the current situation.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Israeli military confirmed that a coffin containing a deceased hostage’s body has crossed into Israel from Gaza, where it will be identified at the National Institute for Forensic Medicine. This follows a ceasefire agreement signed on October 9, which required Hamas to return all deceased hostages within 72 hours—only 12 out of 28 have been returned so far. One of those bodies was misidentified, raising concerns about compliance. Amid accusations of violations from both sides, high-level diplomatic talks between Israel and Hamas, mediated by U.S. officials Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, continue. Knesset Speaker Amir Ohana stressed that the return of all deceased hostages is a non-negotiable obligation, highlighting the political and humanitarian urgency of the situation.
title: Israeli Military Says Body of Deceased Hostage Crosses Into Israel
